aquametNWCA 2.4.4
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Calculate Metrics
    • Calculate VMMI

    Prepare data for calculating metrics - alternative version

    nwcaVegData.Rd

    Assemble datasets from data frame containing vegetation cover by sampID variables and PLOT, and taxa lists containing variables used in metric calculation. Species-, genus-, and family-level datasets are summarized by plot and sample. For the species-level output data summarized by sampID variables, various traits are added to the output data set.

    nwcaVegData(
  vascIn,
  sampID = "UID",
  taxon_name,
  inTaxa = taxaNWCA,
  inNat = ccNatNWCA,
  inCVal = ccNatNWCA,
  inWIS = wisNWCA,
  state = "STATE",
  coeReg = "USAC_REGION",
  cValReg = "STATE"
)

    Arguments

    vascIn

    Data frame containing cover data summarized by sampID variables, PLOT, and taxon value, with the following variable names:

    • sampID A character vector containing the name(s) of variable(s) necessary to identify unique samples, 'UID' by default

    • PLOT: Plot number of data

    • variable name provided in taxon_name: Taxon name, based on USDA PLANTS names, supplemented with NWCA names, if not in USDA PLANTS

    • COVER: Percent cover of taxon in plot, including zeros for plots in which a taxon does not occur.

    • Variable named in state: Two-letter state postal code of site, used to link native status to taxa in native status taxalist (inNat)

    • Variable named in coeReg: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers region abbreviation for sample, to correspond to GEOG_ID in Wetland Indicator Status taxalist (inWIS)

    • Variable named in cValReg: NWCA C-value regions: values must match GEOG_ID in C-value taxalist (inCVal)

    sampID

    A character vector containing the name(s) of variable(s) necessary to identify unique samples, 'UID' by default

    taxon_name

    String containing the name of variable for taxon name in vascIn and in taxalists.

    inTaxa

    Data frame with all taxa in vascIn, with variables:

    • variable name provided in taxon_name: Taxon name, based on USDA PLANTS names, supplemented with NWCA names, if not in USDA PLANTS

    • FAMILY: Family name of taxon

    • GENUS: Genus name of taxon

    • CATEGORY (optional): USDA PLANTS category variable, necessary to calculate category metrics.

    • DURATION (optional): USDA PLANTS duration variable, necessary to calculate duration metrics.

    • GROWTH_HABIT (optional): USDA PLANTS growth habit variable,necessary to calculate growth habit metrics

    • SPECIES_NAME_ID (optional): Taxonomic ID number, which will be used in Bray-Curtis distance metrics if available.

    inNat

    Data frame with native status:

    • variable name provided in taxon_name: Taxon name, based on USDA PLANTS names, supplemented with NWCA names, if not in USDA PLANTS

    • GEOG_ID: Postal abbreviation for STATE of taxon

    • NWCA_NATSTAT: Native status variable, as used in NWCA, necessary to calculate native status metrics.

    inCVal

    Data frame with coefficient of conservatism values:

    • USDA_NAME: Taxon name

    • GEOG_ID: Code indicating C region for site, as supplied with cover data.

    • NWCA_CVAL: Coefficient of conservatism (C-value), as used in NWCA, necessary to calculate metrics based on C-values.

    inWIS

    Data frame with Wetland Indicator Status, from U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USAC):

    • variable name provided in taxon_name: Taxon name, based on USDA PLANTS names, supplemented with NWCA names, if not in USDA PLANTS

    • GEOG_ID: USAC region, abbreviated to match those used in input data frame

    • WIS: Wetland Indicator Status as provided by USAC or added for NWCA

    state

    String containing the name of the state in vascIn, with default value of 'STATE'

    coeReg

    String containing the name of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers region in vascIn associated with Wetland Indicator Status, with default value of 'USAC_REGION'

    cValReg

    String containing the name of the Coefficient of Conservatism region in vascIn, with default value of 'STATE'

    Value

    A list containing six data frames:

    • byUIDspp: Data frame with data summarized by sampID variables and TAXON at the species level and contains:

      • sampID: Variable(s) identified in sampID argument

      • cValReg (as specified in function arguments): Coefficient of Conservatism region associated with site, necessary for merging with inCVal, with default of 'STATE'

      • state: Two-letter state code value (will match name specified in function arguments)

      • coeReg: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers region code value (will match name specified in function arguments)

      • TAXON: Taxon name

      • NUM: Number of occurrences of taxon across plots

      • XABCOV: Mean percent absolute cover of taxon across plots

      • DISTINCT: Distinctness value for each taxon, 1 if the taxon has COVER>0 and 0 if not.

      • NPLOTS: Number of plots in sample (1-5)

      • TOTN: Total number of taxa in sample

      • XTOTABCOV: Sum of XABCOV across all taxa in sample

      • sXRCOV: taxon mean relative cover (XABCOV/XTOTABCOV)*100

      • FREQ: Relative number of plots in which taxon occurs (NUM/NPLOTS)*100

      • TOTFREQ: Sum of FREQ across all taxa in sample

      • SRFREQ: Relative frequency of taxon relative to total frequency (FREQ/TOTFREQ)*100

      This data frame is also merged with the input taxa data frames and contains, in addition, GENUS and FAMILY, but also contains (depending on the input taxa lists): CATEGORY, DURATION, GROWTH_HABIT, NWCA_CC, NWCA_NATSTAT, WIS.

    • byPlotspp: Data frame with data summarized by sampID variables, PLOT, and TAXON at the species level. Each data frame contains:

      • sampID Variables identified in sampID argument

      • PLOT: Plot number

      • state: Two-letter state code value associated with native status (will match name specified in function arguments)

      • coeReg: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers region code value (will match name specified in function arguments)

      • cValReg: Site region associated with Coefficient of Conservatism value (will match name specified in function arguments)

      • TAXON: Taxon name

      • COVER: Sum of cover by TAXON within plot

      • DISTINCT: Distinctness of taxon, value of 1 assigned to each row

    • byUIDgen: Data frame with data summarized by sampID variables and TAXON at the genus level and contains sampID, cValReg variable, coeReg, TAXON, NUM, XABCOV, and DISTINCT. NUM is the number of plots in which taxon occurs, and XABCOV is the mean absolute COVER across plots. DISTINCT is the value 1 assigned to each row.

    • byPlotgen: Data frame with data summarized by sampID variables, PLOT, and TAXON at the genus level. Each data frame contains sampID, PLOT, cValReg variable, coeReg, TAXON, COVER, and DISTINCT. DISTINCT assigns the value for each taxon as 1 if the taxon has COVER>0 or 0 if not. COVER is the sum of the COVER variable.

    • byUIDfam: Data frame with data summarized by sampID variables and TAXON at the family level and contains sampID, cValReg variable, coeReg, TAXON, NUM, XABCOV, and DISTINCT. NUM is the number of plots in which taxon occurs, and XABCOV is the mean absolute COVER across plots. DISTINCT is the value 1 assigned to each row.

    • byPlotfam: Data frame with data summarized by sampID , PLOT, and TAXON at the family level. Each data frame contains sampID, PLOT, cValReg variable, coeReg, TAXON, COVER, and DISTINCT. DISTINCT assigns the value for each taxon as 1 if the taxon has COVER>0 or 0 if not. COVER is the sum of the COVER variable.

    Details

    This function calls the createDFs() function, which sums cover by sampID variables, PLOT, TAXON, with sums > 100 truncated to 100 percent.

    References

    US Environmental Protection Agency. 2016. National Wetland Condition Assessment: 2011 Technical Report. EPA-843-R-15-006. US Environmental Protection Agency, Washington, DC.

    Author

    Karen Blocksom blocksom.karen@epa.gov

    Examples

    head(VascPlantEx)
#>   UID STATE USAC_REGION PLOT             USDA_NAME COVER
#> 1   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    2 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA    28
#> 2   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    3 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA     6
#> 3   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    4 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA     5
#> 4   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    5 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA    20
#> 5   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    5       SPARTINA PATENS     0
#> 6   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    1      PANICUM VIRGATUM     0
prepEx <- nwcaVegData(vascIn = VascPlantEx, taxon_name = "USDA_NAME", cValReg = "STATE")
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done preparing datasets"

str(prepEx)
